think_procedure: First, identify the purpose of the knob 'effective_io_concurrency' in PostgreSQL.
Understand the regular operation of this knob, which is to control the number of concurrent disk I/O operations PostgreSQL can perform.
Investigate if there are any special values that alter the regular functioning of this knob.
Research the official PostgreSQL documentation or trusted sources to verify if there are any special values.
Find that setting 'effective_io_concurrency' to 0 disables the asynchronous I/O feature, which is a special function compared to its regular operation.
Conclude that since there is a special value (0) that changes the behavior of the knob, it qualifies as a 'special knob'.
